title: ggplot2 snippets
text:
Preface
This is a Quarto book about code snippets in ggplot2 which i find useful .

title: 1  Introduction
text:
This is a book created from markdown and executable code which helps me to easier remember some nice plotting snippets using the ggplot2 library and its extensions.
Official ressource by ggplot2 creator Wickham (2016).




Wickham, Hadley. 2016. Ggplot2: Elegant Graphics for Data Analysis. Springer-Verlag New York. https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org.

title: 2  Basic ggplot2
text:
Providing only data will results in a empty plot:

library(ggplot2)
ggplot(data = mtcars)








so add an aesthetic. The plot will still be empty since no geom is added.

ggplot(data = mtcars, mapping = aes(x = mpg, y = disp))








Add a geom to add a layer.

ggplot(data = mtcars, mapping = aes(x = mpg, y = disp)) + 
geom_point()

title: 3  Interactivity with ggiraph
text:
The package ggiraph (Gohel and Skintzos (2025)) makes ggplot graphics interactive.
Example from here.
Hovering over the point shows the names of the cars.

library(ggplot2)
library(ggiraph)

dataset <- mtcars
dataset$carname <- row.names(mtcars)

gg <- ggplot(
  data = dataset,
  mapping = aes(
    x = wt, y = qsec, color = disp,
    tooltip = carname, data_id = carname
  )
) +
  geom_point_interactive()

girafe(ggobj = gg)





Don’t forget to call the girafe function otherwise it will be a plain ggplot image and not an interactive plot.




Gohel, David, and Panagiotis Skintzos. 2025. Ggiraph: Make ’Ggplot2’ Graphics Interactive. https://davidgohel.github.io/ggiraph/.
